newsitem.title: USA: Mitchell says Texas jury finds for it in lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Mitchell says Texas jury finds for it in lawsuit.

text.p: A jury in Wise County, Texas, found in favor of Mitchell Energy & Development Corp in a case involving 17 plaintiff groups claiming the company's oil and gas operations in North Texas had affected their water wells, Mitchell said in a statement.
"While a final judgment has not yet been entered in the case, Mitchell expects the trial court to confirm the jury's verdict," Mitchell said in a statement.
This lawsuit, known as the "Bailey" case, went to trial on March 17 in the 271st District Court in Decatur.
"Today's Bailey verdict is a very important victory and strengthens our belief that we will eventually be vindicated in the Bartlett judgment as well," Mitchell said.
Another Wise County jury last year awarded $4 million in actual and $200 million in exemplary damages to eight plaintiff groups in a lawsuit known as the "Bartlett" case.
The company has appealed the Bartlett judgment to the Second Court of Appeals in Fort Worth, Texas, where a decision is expected in the next several months.
